pros: Paid $13 hourly until license came in and then paid at $17 hourly
cons:
Unprofessional, childish and immature co-workers
Lots of ignorant people
Favoritism
Cliques.
Immature Co-workers.
. I suffered emotional abuse, harassment and bullying from my co-workers and it only got worse when I went to HR and to my supervisors to address the issue.
If you are that DESPERATE enough for a job, I HIGHLY recommend you look elsewhere. Don't come here. It isn't worth the heartache or the trouble. To everyone currently working there now. I feel BAD for you. This is the best job you are ever going to get.
advice_to_mgmt:
When someone tells you they are being harassed and bullied by several people on a campaign, believe them. I quit because of the unprofessional-ism at that place. It's worse than high school. It's just a bunch of angry, middle- aged and elderly people who peaked early in life who are upset because they aren't skilled or capable enough to have a REAL SUSTAINABLE career taking out their frustrations on those of us who have real aspirations and dreams outside of working in a call center.

I am lucky enough that I found a job in what I went to school for and that I left this terrible place. This center should be shut down and especially everyone on the AON campaign needs to be fired. I suffered emotional abuse, harassment and bullying from my co-workers and it only got worse when I went to HR and to my supervisors to address the issue. I ended up trying to take my own life due to the severity of my bullying that no one seemed to care about trying to stop. I have moved on to a job that I love, but NO ONE deserves to be treated so poorly and then have management take the side of the instigators and abusers in the situation. 0/0 Would not recommend.

pros: Great 4 day shift options with Fridays off.
cons: Oppressive workplace. Jealously rampant. Cliques. Unfair reviews. Constant write-ups. Negative work environment. Only 10% survive to 12 mo. mark from a training class of 27. Nice Supervisors who are fair and coach to help the agent succeed are the exception.
advice_to_mgmt: Train your supervisors to manage. Those who are in supervisory positions are there only because they are competent on the Medicare Rules. Revolving door. $10 hour pay in the average. Bonuses are almost impossible to achieve. No upward mobility path.

pros: The paychecks clear. Co-workers were great.
cons: Company damaging employees futures with useless job titles. No future with this company. Long hours. Run by foreigners overseas. Layoffs very common and sporadic, often made by someone who has never visited the site in person. Would recommend to someone I dislike as a form of payback or revenge perhaps.

pros: Consistent hours from week to week.
cons: Pay, demands on employees. Treated like cattle

pros: You are left to do your job. They believe everyone is capable. Theres an onsite food vendor as well as vendors who come twice weekly.
cons: You're just a number. Unless you work in a specialized department no one knows your name. You dont get bio breaks and must take any time ysed out of your scheduled break.
advice_to_mgmt: Know your people they are your customers. This is not just your direct reports every employee deseves you knowing who they are. Dont hold team meetings in break areas.
